column1: What is Python and what are its main advantages?
column2: Python is an interpreted high-level programming language for general-purpose programming...

column1: What is a tuple in Python and how is it different from a list?
column2: In Python
column3: a tuple is an immutable sequence of objects of any type
column4: while a list is a mutable sequence of objects of any type...

column1: What are the differences between a function and a method in Python?
column2: In Python
column3: a function is a group of related statements that perform a specific task
column4: while a method is a function that belongs to an object...

column1: What is Python?
column2: It is a high-level

column1: What is PEP8?
column2: It is a style guide for writing Python code.

column1: What is a tuple?
column2: It is an immutable collection of ordered elements

column1: What is a set?
column2: It is a collection of unique elements

column1: What is a dictionary?
column2: It is a collection of key-value pairs
column3: enclosed in curly braces and separated by colons.

column1: What is a lambda function?
column2: It is an anonymous function that can take any number of arguments but can only have one expression.

column1: What is the difference between a list and a tuple?
column2: A list is mutable while a tuple is immutable.

column1: What is the difference between a set and a frozenset?
column2: A set is mutable while a frozenset is immutable.

column1: What is the difference between a dictionary and a list?
column2: A dictionary stores values with keys while a list stores values with indices.

column1: What is the difference between == and is in Python?
column2: == checks for value equality while is checks for object identity.

column1: What is the purpose of the __init__ method in a Python class?
column2: It is a constructor method that initializes the object's attributes when the object is created.

column1: What is the purpose of the __str__ method in a Python class?
column2: It returns a string representation of the object when the object is printed or converted to a string.

column1: What is the purpose of the __len__ method in a Python class?
column2: It returns the length of the object when the object's length is requested.

column1: What is the purpose of the __getitem__ method in a Python class?
column2: It returns the value of the specified item in the object when the item is accessed with indexing.

column1: What is the purpose of the __setitem__ method in a Python class?
column2: It sets the value of the specified item in the object when the item is assigned with indexing.

column1: What is the purpose of the __delitem__ method in a Python class?
column2: It removes the specified item from the object when the item is deleted with indexing.

column1: What is the purpose of the __iter__ method in a Python class?
column2: It returns an iterator object that can be used to loop through the object's values.

column1: What is the purpose of the __next__ method in a Python class?
column2: It returns the next value in the iterator object when the iterator is used to loop through the object's values.

column1: What is the purpose of the super() function in Python?
column2: It is used to call a method in a parent class from a subclass.

column1: What is a decorator in Python?
column2: It is a special type of function that can modify or enhance the behavior of another function.

column1: What is a generator in Python?
column2: It is a function that returns an iterator object that can be used to generate a sequence of values on the fly
column3: instead of generating all values at once.

column1: What is a context manager in Python?
column2: It is an object that can be used with the "with" statement to manage resources
column3: such as opening and closing files or database connections.

column1: What is a module in Python?
column2: It is a file containing Python definitions and statements that can be imported and used in other Python programs.

column1: What is a package in Python?
column2: It is a collection of modules that are organized into a directory hierarchy.

column1: What is the difference between an abstract class and an interface in Python?
column2: An abstract class can have method implementations while an interface only defines method signatures.

column1: What is the purpose of the re module in Python?
column2: It is used for working with regular expressions in Python.

column1: What is a regular expression in Python?
column2: It is a sequence of characters that defines a search pattern for matching text.
